label: Description
value: Oval tureen (a) with stepped domed lid (b) having shaped edge and center knop; oval stand (c) with shaped edge; all with white ground decorated with ochre flowers and foliage; narrow band along edges of cover and stand.

label: Dimensions
value: H x W x D (a,b,c: overall): 23.5 x 41 x 30 cm (9 1/4 x 16 1/8 x 11 13/16 in.) H x W x D (a: tureen): 38 x 28 cm (14 15/16 in. x 11 in.) H x W x D (b: lid): 36 x 26 cm (14 3/16 x 10 1/4 in.) H x W x D (c: stand): 39.5 x 30 cm (15 9/16 x 11 13/16 in.)

label: Provenance
value: Eugene V. and Clare E. Thaw; 2008: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eugene V. and Clare E. Thaw

label: Description
value: Circular form with shaped rim decorated with green and ochre borders surrounding floral garlands; center decorated with green, blue-green, and ochre scene in landscape within scrollwork rocaille border. Central scene shows a seated woman wearing a crown. At her feet is a globe and cornucopia with money. Before her, an angel offers a building.

value: Eugene V. and Clare E. Thaw; 2008: acquired by Museum

label: Provenance
value: 1865-90: Emperor Francis Josef I [1]; 2009: acquired by Museum (from Harald, Peter and Stefan Rath)                [1] This set was ordered by Emperor Francis Josef I for roughly 50 persons, to be used for very special dinners in the Hofburg only (1865-1890).

value: Between 1880 and 1905, some 1,500 guests--among them architects, politicians, scientists, and artists--were invited to Ludwig Lobmeyr's dinner parties, where this set was used.
